Hey everybody. My name is Nathan Segal and I want to welcome you to my channel. So chances are you're looking at the title and you're thinking how in the world did he come up with that well. It's both simple and complex, but essentially. 

When I was 19 years old, I was in a religious cult. Was under this group. They called themselves a born again Christians and they were a part of a church called First Assembly Pentecostal in Calgary. 

Years later I was chatting with a friend of mine, a guy by the name of Mike Kropveld, and Mike runs the Citizens Information Center in Montreal and it's all about helping people who are involved with call groups or want to get out of them? 

I was sitting with Mike day and we were talking and he said, I know why you were so susceptible to winding up in a cult. I'm sitting there going. Yeah, really. He said. You grew up in a cult. Your family, your parents were cult leaders. 

It was one of those pie in the face moments that I I have to tell you because I instantly recognized that he was right. And. Explained so much and it also tied into another thing that happened after my mother died. 

You know, I've been a part of a group where we were talking about post traumatic stress disorder and for a year, people were yapping about narcissism. Every time they did it were. No, no, I I I don't want to hear it. Leave me alone. And then my mother died. And then a guy I know by the name of Mark Santos, he sent me a video to a guy by the name of Ross Rosenberg, and he was about covert narcissism.

Now, for decades before that, my family, I was trying to figure out what went wrong, why my family was so weird, why there was so much. What I could see is mental illness. I thought it was bipolar. That's what seemed to be the diagnosis, but I didn't know any. I was sitting there one day. I got this video. I watched it and afterwards I just thought oh shit!, because I instantly recognized my mother as a covert narcissist. My father as a narcissist and my brother and all of a sudden everything fell into place and I understood. 

And that's where so much of this came from. So anyway, what you're going to see on this side are snippets of my story. Highlights different things that I learned over the years. 

If you have any questions, reach out to.
